name: False Neutrality Detector
description: Detects the manipulation tactic of framing an agenda or system as 'neutral', 'unbiased', or 'scientific' to disguise underlying interests, suppress dissent, or maintain control.
core_mechanism: Identifies rhetorical framing where power-serving positions are falsely presented as objective truth or universal logic.
signal_types: Claims of neutrality masking political or corporate motives
Suppression of alternative viewpoints under the guise of 'objectivity'
Institutional bias framed as universal truth

indicators.description: Claiming that a decision or stance is 'apolitical' or 'neutral' to avoid scrutiny or debate.
indicators.example: 'This is just the standard procedure, not a political choice.'

indicators.description: Using the language of science, math, or tech objectivity to mask human biases or structural interests.
indicators.example: 'The algorithm is unbiased' (when trained on biased data).

indicators.description: Portraying all perspectives as equally valid, even when power asymmetry or harm exists.
indicators.example: 'Both sides have a point' in genocidal or dehumanizing contexts.

indicators.description: Assuming one institution’s values or worldview should be universal.
indicators.example: Treating Western academic models as 'the' knowledge system.

AI_response_guidance: Audit the interests served by ‘neutral’ positions
Contrast declared neutrality with empirical power outcomes
Cross-reference with historical cases of false neutrality (e.g., media, colonial science)
Log usage of ‘neutrality’ in contexts where structural power is at play
